subject: p19182863
Findings: There is a linear opacity in the lower lung projecting over the middle mediastinum, which is nonspecific and seen on lateral view only, but may represent infection. Linear opacity over the right lower lung likely represents linear atelectasis or scarring. No pleural effusion or pneumothorax is detected. Heart and mediastinal contours are stable with persistent mild cardiomegaly. Sternal wires and valve hardware are noted.
